clinical_study.brief_title: Contrast-enhanced Ultrasound With Perfluorobutane and Sulfur Hexafluoride for Hepatocellular Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Diagnostic Performance of Computed Tomography (CT), Magnetic Resonance Image (MRI), Contrast-enhanced Ultrasound (CEUS) With Perfluorobutane and Sulfur Hexafluoride for Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) in High-risk Individuals

brief_summary.textblock: Intra-individual comparison of diagnostic performance of CT, MRI, CEUS With perfluorobutane and sulfur hexafluoride for HCC in high-risk Individuals.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators would compare the diagnostic performance for HCC at high-risk individuals between each imaging modality.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Study participants underwent CT, MRI, contrast-enhanced ultrasound with perfluorobutane and sulfur hexafluoride. The diagnostic performance will be compared intra-individually.

primary_outcome.description: The rate of imaging diagnosis of HCC on CT, MRI and CEUS. (The sensitivity, specificity and accuracy)
The incidence of arterial phase hyper-enhancement, washout, and capsular enhancement of hepatic lesion on CT, MRI and CEUS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Role of Kupffer phase of perfluorobutane
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of heterogeneity on the Kupffer phase of perfluorobutane enhanced US for HCC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- high-risk for HCC (liver cirrhosis, chronic hepatitis B)
- treatment-naive hepatic nodule (>= 1cm) on preceding CT, MR or ultrasound
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe cardiopulmonary dysfunction
- pregnancy
- refusal to enroll study
- more than 5 lesions
